intro: Monadenia macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked monadenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, typical of many species in the Rubiaceae family.
